I don‚Äôt spend my time at fancy closed-door fundraisers trading favors for money, and I‚Äôll appoint only the most qualified person for the job. In a Warren administration, I pledge not to give ambassadorial posts to wealthy donors or bundlers. Period.

To do this, we need to recruit a new generation of foreign service officers and retain talented officers. I‚Äôll also significantly expand the pool of diplomatic talent. Today‚Äôs foreign service is 79% white and 65% male. Our foreign service must reflect the diversity of the U.S.

Our foreign policy should not be run out of the Pentagon. Under a Warren administration, it won‚Äôt be. So I‚Äôll start by doubling the size of the foreign service and opening new diplomatic posts in underserved areas to broaden U.S. diplomatic presence.

The Pentagon is nearly 40 times bigger than the State Department‚Äîwe employ more people in military grocery stores than we do foreign service officers. Our underinvestment in diplomacy causes our leaders to default to military action, instead of treating it as a last resort.

Senior career officials at the State Department have been pushed out & others have resigned in protest. We've lost 60% of our career ambassadors & 20% of our most experienced civil servants. Too often they've been replaced with totally unqualified campaign donors & Trump cronies.

To take a meaningful leadership position in the world, protect our interests, and avoid conflicts, we need world-class diplomats. But through a toxic combination of malice and neglect, Donald Trump has declared war on the State Department.
